result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Signed at MCJ 10/12/17
**Includes 15CF1210, 15CM573, 15CM801 & 15CM998

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:53pm
INCLUDES 15CF1210, 15CM573, 15CM801, 15CM998
State appears by ADA Davis Runde.  Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Zachary Glascock.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to dismiss outright charges in 15CF1210
COURT dismisses charges in 15CF1210 outright
State moves to:
15CM573:
Ct. 1 Operating while revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal- repeater >> D&RI
15CM801:
Ct. 1 Operating while revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal- repeater >> D&RI
15CM998:
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor- repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA:
15CM998:
Ct. 1 Disorderly Conduct- repeater >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor- repeater >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: on both counts- Serve 6 months MCJ, concurrent. Jail may be with huber release for work or work search if meets jail criteria. 88 days credit granted. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. 
Adj: 4:07pm
Plea hearing on January 3, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
